title: Where is the highest vertical point on earth? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mt. Everest has the highest altitude of 8,850 meters. In stating vertical, I am assuming that this vertical is the same as altitude. It is not the tallest mountain, from top to bottom, but it is the highest above sea level. Mauna Kea in Hawaii is the tallest from top to bottom at about 10,000 meters, part of which is below sea level.

Because of the equatorial bulge, the summit of Mount Chimborazo in the Andes is the point on the Earth that is farthest from the center, and is 2,168 m (7,113 ft) farther from the Earth's center than the summit of Everest. Wikipedia
